creditline: The Francisca S. Winston Fund, by exchange

text: Nauman's screenprint is one of five prints from a series of studies he produced during his early artistic investigations, in which he used his own body as both the material and the subject of his work. Thematically related to his 1968 film <I>Pulling Faces<I>, the performance art series is derived from infrared photographs of the artist taken by his friend Jack Fulton.
title: Pulled Lower Lip, from Studies for Holograms
